channel.title: Posts on Hybrid prediction notes
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Hybrid prediction notes

item.title: Hydrology meeting notes
item.description: Present Dan MacKinlay Dan Pagendam Tao Cui Petra Since last time ICASSP happened Main result of interest: model driven filtering (Revach et al. 2021; Shlezinger et al. 2020). Software engineeering Much software engineering has been happening This is needed so that code is cleaner (nice) code can be parallelized on our HPC (needed eventually) input data can be generalized (needed right now) This work is conducted in collaboration with Alasdair Tran at ANU CECs.

item.title: Hydrology meeting notes
item.description: Present Tao Cui Dan Pagendam David Robertson Dan MacKinlay Since last time MARS2021 üòÖ groundwater modeling review doc commenced further development in Fourier Neural Operator ported reference PDE solver to pytorch 1.8 so that it can be run with the emulator Discussions FNO matters arising. Induces multiple UQ problems emulator OOD uncertainty classic model uncertainty Conditionalising on latent parameters (WIP)

item.title: Hydrology meeting notes
item.description: Present Dan MacKinlay Tao Cui Dan Pagendam Since last time data concatenation bug bugfix submitted to Zongyi Li His code now performs better (!), and the results beat the published work our code updated to pytorch 1.8 (faster and simpler) challenge: there is still bad prediction on the synthetic test data. Discussions challenge: New experiments support the idea that the problem with bad performance on synthetic test data is not the code bug, but that out-of-distribution predictions are bad.

item.title: Hydrology meeting notes
item.description: Present Tao Cui Petra Kuhnert Dan Pagendam David Robertson Dan MacKinlay Since last time Simulation progress Tao and Dan have been working on generic simulations via MODFLOW to match the neural emulator. Plan to get modflow output that includes time-step data, not simply the data from the end of each stress period parse HDS-output to access this from python. Tao has provided scripts for this Notes on Li et al.

item.title: Hydrology meeting notes
item.description: Present Dan Pagendam Tao Cui Dan MacKinlay Since last time Dan M implemented the Li et al. (2020) method, trained it (Navier Stokes version) and tested it on artificial data. Discussions Dan M Questions can we get gradient out of MODFLOW sims? Tao: from alternative version Dan M: I think this is low priority now how close to advection-diffusion are we in groundwater?

item.title: Hydrology meeting notes
item.description: Present Dan MacKinlay Petra Kuhnert Dan Pagendam Since last time Dan M has been reviewing alternative techniques from the literature for non-stationary PDEs Weak formulation Bao et al. (2020); Zang et al. (2020). This is very clever, but does not solve the problem that it is hard to use the ‚Äúimplicit representation‚Äù output, and it is hard to see how it could generalise to multiple problems.

item.title: Hydrology meeting notes
item.description: Present Dan Pagendam Tao Cui Dan MacKinlay Since last time Dan M ran a reading group on Physics informed NNs under undertainty (Raissi, Perdikaris, and Karniadakis 2019; Zhang et al. 2019) Consolidated all notes into a repository https://github.com/csiro-mlai/HybridPredictionReview/ Published online at csiro-mlai.github.io/HybridPredictionReview/ Discussions Tao on Ensembling and subspace methods (Siade, Putti, and Yeh 2010; Tonkin and Doherty 2009; White 2018) Next steps Dan M: Non-stationary inference methods investigation, e.

item.title: Hybrid Hydrology check-in
item.description: class: center Groundwater emulation check-in New kanban board https://github.com/orgs/csiro-mlai/projects/3 Loss surface approximation GroundwaterEmulation/SurrogateOpt Neural operator approximation GroundwaterEmulation/NN_Operator Structure-free model (WIP) GroundwaterEmulation/StructureFreeModel Random net/SDE/GP translation (WIP) Translates between SDEs, covariance kernels, and NNs. \[\begin{aligned} \hat{\kappa}(\mathbf{\hat{x}}_p, \mathbf{\hat{x}}_q) &= \mathbb{E}[\psi(\mathbf{W}^\top \mathbf{\hat{x}}_p) \psi(\mathbf{W}^\top \mathbf{\hat{x}}_q)] \\ &= \Vert \mathbf{\hat{x}}_p \Vert \Vert \mathbf{\hat{x}}_q \Vert \mathbb{E}[\psi(\mathbf{W}^\top \mathbf{\hat{x}}_p/\Vert \mathbf{\hat{x}}_p \Vert ) \psi(\mathbf{W}^\top \mathbf{\hat{x}}_q/\Vert \mathbf{\hat{x}}_q \Vert )] \\ &= \Vert \mathbf{\hat{x}}_p \Vert \Vert \mathbf{\hat{x}}_q \Vert \underbrace{\mathbb{E}[\psi(\mathbf{W}^\top \mathbf{x}_p ) \psi(\mathbf{W}^\top \mathbf{x}_q )]}_{\kappa(\mathbf{x}_p, \mathbf{x}_q)}, \end{aligned}\]
